description:
It is time again!

We are very excited to announce our second MLOps Community Meetup in Bristol.

The meetup will be hosted at Just Eat offices 👏.

**Just Eat offices are located at Broad Quay House, BS1 4DJ.** Head into reception (through the rotating doors/accessible entrance) to sign in. The meetup is on the 2nd floor. Lifts are available.

There will be food, drink, and a couple of talks from some great speakers (Speakers confirmed and we will add their talks titles/abstracts soon).

**Timetable:**
**18:00:** Welcome drinks and food

**18:30**: Talk 1 - **[Bernard Camus](https://www.linkedin.com/in/bernardcamus/)**

**Dataiku: A review of lo-code MLOps**

How I used Dataiku Lo-Code ML Ops to (unsuccessfully) predict the stock market, and some of the pitfalls I found along the way.

**19:00**: Short Break

**19:10**: Talk 2 - **[Jose Navarro](https://www.linkedin.com/in/jose-navarro-2a57b612/)** & **[Prayana Galih](https://www.linkedin.com/in/prayana-galih-b7013b8/)**[ ](https://www.linkedin.com/in/prayana-galih-b7013b8/) from Cookpad:

**Recipe to automate the deployment of your models into shared GPU Infrastructure**

At the last Kubecon Europe conference, Jose and Prayana talked about how Nvidia Triton Inference Server had improved 3 pillars of their model deployment; cost-efficiency, performance, and user experience ([recording](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YMtLI1Ub85s)).

In this talk, they will explain how they have recently improved user experience even further by integrating MLFlow Model Registry and Triton for a seamless and automated model deployment from the MLFlow UI.

**19:40**: Social (Food/Drink)

**20:30**(ish): Networking continues at a pub for those that wish.

This event is brought to you by [neptune.ai](http://neptune.ai/).
title: MLOps Bristol - Meetup #2
